items.message:

Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 . 
River levels are rising due to Thursday’s rain and are expected to peak over night.
Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible this evening from approximately 7pm and overnight tonight, Thursday 15 January 2026. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels are expected to be high due to the natural tide locking effects. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Avoid using low lying footpaths which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are high in response to heavy rainfall earlier in December. Levels are slowly falling but remain high, and flooding of fields and roads is still possible. Groundwater levels are falling but further rainfall in the coming days may lead to levels rising once more. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 20th January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 6pm. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads along the River Brede, particularly around Winchelsea, and along the River Tillingham between Broad Oak and Rye. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 10:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from approximately 19:00. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land, footpaths and roads near rivers, in particular around the Otford and Shoreham areas. We expect river levels to remain high well into tomorrow, Friday 16th January 2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further messages as required. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Littlemead Brook, Cranleigh Waters, Hascombe Stream

items.message:
High river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the afternoon of 15 January 2026 . 
Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected, especially in the Cranleigh area. Further light rainfall is forecast overnight. We expect river levels to rise until tomorrow morning 16 January. 
We are closely monitoring the situation .We are clearing blockages from debris screens. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 . from 17:00, as a lot of rain is forecast today (20mm). 
Minor flooding could affect gardens of Tanbridge Park, Blackbridge Court, and Arunside School fields. From 03:00 16/01/2026 flooding will affect gardens of mill properties between Broadbridge Heath and Billingshurst. From 13:00 16/01/2026 gardens near Pallingham Lock could be affected. Peaks similar to 09/01/2026. Rain is forecast to ease by 22:00 15/01/2026, with only isolated showers Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce by 08:00 16/01/2026 in Horsham, but not until 23:00 16/01/2026 near Pallingham Lock. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . Our automatic sluice at Provender Mill is operating to reduce flood risk. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Install flood protection products in Wanford, if you have them. 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Mock Bridge, near Shermanbury on the River Adur
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding on Thursday. 
Flooding is expected on 16 January 2026 from 23:00, as a lot of rain (25mm) fell on Thursday. 
Flooding will affect the A281 at Mock Bridge, near Shermanbury. As well as extensive water in fields, flooding will also affect properties near Mock Bridge and their gardens. Only isolated showers are forecast between Friday and Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce at Mock Bridge by 12:00 16/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood (A281 at Mock Bridge). 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 Heavy rain has fallen through Thursday 15 January. 
River levels are rising leading to flooding of low lying land and roads especially areas around River Beult from Bethersden and Pluckley to Stile Bridge, including Smarden, Headcorn, Staplehurst and Hawkenbury. Flooding of land is expected from 9pm Thursday.

items.description: Barcombe Mills on the River Ouse
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding on Friday. 
Flooding is expected on 16 January 2026 from 01:00, as a lot of rain (30mm) fell on Thursday. 
Flooding will affect fields (extensively). Barcombe Mills road and Anchor Lane are likely to be impassable. The Anchor Inn is expected to flood. Flood water may also approach isolated properties at Barcombe Mills from 04:00 16/01/2026. River levels could peak higher than 09/01/2026. Only isolated showers are forecast until Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Barcombe by 13:00 16/01/2026, and return nearer to normal by Saturday evening. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and operating our structures at Anchor Gates and Barcombe Mills. 
Activate any flood protection products you may have . Including at Barcombe Mills. Avoid Barcombe Mills Road and Anchor Lane. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high throughout the evening of Thursday 15 January 2026 and into Friday. This may lead to flooding. 
Low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Abridge area, will be most affected. Property flooding is not expected. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and checking river and rainfall levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 16:00PM on Friday 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from overnight on 15 January 2026. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including the Morrisons parks at Glenfield and Anstey. Low-lying land and farmlands in the Glenfield, Anstey, Sileby, Thurcaston, Rothley, Newtown Linford, Cropston, Swithland and Quorn areas. Rainfall is forecast this afternoon and evening. River levels at Glenfield Gauge will continue to rise until the early hours of 16/01/2026.We are closely monitoring the situation & liaising with professional partners. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding of low-lying areas. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. No further significant rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. River levels at Trowell Gauge are likely to remain high until tomorrow morning 16/01/26. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00am on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lindfield Bridge on the River Ouse
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected on 15 January 2026 from 22:00, as a lot of rain (27mm) fell on Thursday. 
Flooding will affect fields, rural roads, gardens and affect properties at Bridge Cottage and Dean's Water Mill at Lindfield Bridge on the B2028 near Lindfield. River levels could peak higher than 19/12/2025. Rain is forecast to ease from 20:30. Only isolated showers are forecast Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce at Lindfield Bridge by 04:00 16/01/2026. River levels should return nearer to normal by Friday afternoon 16/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation operating our structure at Pimms Lock. 
Activate any flood protection products you may have . Including at Lindfield Bridge and Dean's Water Mill, if you have them. 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected on 15 January 2026 from 11:00pm. 
Heavy rainfall has caused river levels on the Kidbrooke stream to rise steadily through the day. Flooding to properties is expected. Properties along Priory Road, Swans Ghyll, Riverside and Blenheim Fields are at immediate risk. If you have them, activate your property protection measures now. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Start acting on your flood plan if you have one and activate any flood protection products you may have. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Freshfield Bridge to Sharpsbridge on the River Ouse
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding on Friday. 
Flooding is expected on 16 January 2026 from 04:00, as a lot of rain (25mm) fell on Thursday. 
Flooding will affect properties and roads at Fletching Mill Bridge and Sharpsbridge. Gardens and fields will flood near Freshfield Mill Farm, Freshmill and Millers Cottages on Sloop Lane and Bridge Cottage, Sheffield Park. Only isolated showers are forecast until Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce near Sloop Lane by 04:00 16/01/2026, and 08:00 16/01/2026 at Sharpsbridge, returning nearer to normal by Saturday evening. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk Avoid roads that flood (Fletching Mill Bridge, Sharpsbridge). 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.
